H0.text: Wave without a medium is how sound travels.

H1.text: A series of compressions only is how sound travels.

H2.text: Pattern of up and down vibrations is how sound travels.

H3.text: A pattern of compressions and rarefactions is the way sound travels.

A4.text: Sound cannot travel through a vacuum.

A5.text: Sound is transmitted through gases, plasma, and liquids as longitudinal waves, also called compression waves.
